intro: Telipogon bullpenensis, commonly known as the Peninsular Telipogon, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded, humid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is of great interest to botanists and conservationists. Its unique botanical features make it a subject of ongoing research in plant ecology and evolutionary biology.
